Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
loser
<jargon> An unexpectedly bad situation, program, programmer, or person. Someone who habitually loses. (Even winners can lose occasionally). Someone who knows not and knows not that he knows not. Emphatic forms are "real loser", "total loser", and "complete loser" (but not **"moby loser", which would be a contradiction in terms).
See {luser}.
[{Jargon File}]
(1995-04-19)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Loser \Los"er\, n. 1. One who loses; as, the loser pays for a round of beer. --South. [1913 Webster]
2. A person who is habitually unsuccessful at some endeavor, such as employment or personal relationships. [slang] [PJC]
3. A plan or strategy unlikely to succeed. [slang] [PJC]

loser n. An unexpectedly bad situation, program, programmer, or person. Someone who habitually loses. (Even winners can lose occasionally.) Someone who knows not and knows not that he knows not. Emphatic forms are `real loser', `total loser', and `complete loser' (but not **`moby loser', which would be a contradiction in terms). See {luser}.

loser n 1: a contestant who loses the contest [syn: {also-ran}] [ant: {winner}] 2: a person with a record of failing; someone who loses consistently [syn: {failure}, {nonstarter}, {unsuccessful person}] [ant: {achiever}] 3: a gambler who loses a bet [ant: {winner}]
